instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F: What is PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F? PP5V_S0_ALSCAM is a power rail for the webcam and the ambient light sensor..
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
threads.message:
hello, there was very small water damage on the screen side connector, i was clean and all look good but no backlight and display.
i was changed screen and flat cable but the same.
on j8500:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> - 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F</SIGNAL> 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
threads.message:
Stable 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> at J8500 means the LCD is detected; <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> should be high.
Probably image is there, but not easy to detect in the new machines.

If really no image for sure, internal eDP video output could be damaged.
Do you get external video?
USB activity confirmed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HP</SIGNAL>  0.1v
external screen working.
touch bar and voice control working

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
threads.message:
i was change <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> from oder board...
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HP</SIGNAL> still 0.1v but diode mode on  <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HP</SIGNAL> (j8500) was 700 and now 1450

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
threads.message:
Very strange to get steady voltages on LCD connector, without <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> signal.
No reason for PCH to maintain <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> signal, if doesn't recognize LCD (missing <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>).
It can only be tricked by <CHIP>U9801</CHIP>, or more probably <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>.
Check <SIGNAL>DP_INT_IG</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>EG_HPD</SIGNAL> levels.
You may need to change <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
threads.message:
Be sure <SIGNAL>LCD_MUX_EN</SIGNAL> is present.
Check all surrounding resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>LCD_MUX_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3v
i was changed <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> again..
around:
<SIGNAL>EDP_MUXSEL_OVR</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>LCD_FFS</SIGNAL> 0V
ALL <SIGNAL>DP_INT</SIGNAL>..0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display no backlight.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> is released by display itself.
You can try another LCD assembly.
